questions.question_text: An auditor is performing an audit on behalf of a cloud customer. For assessing security awareness, the auditor should:

choices.A: assess the existence and adequacy of a security awareness training program at the cloud service provider’s organization as the cloud customer hired the auditor to review and cloud service.
choices.B: assess the existence and adequacy of a security awareness training program at both the cloud customer’s organization and the cloud service provider’s organization.
choices.D: not assess the security awareness training program as it is each organization’s responsibility
choices.C: assess the existence and adequacy of a security awareness training program at the cloud customer’s organization as they hired the auditor.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Auditors should assess adequacy of security awareness program at both cloud customer organization and cloud service providers organization. 

CCAK Study Guide page 270

Selected Answer: B
CCAK P# 86To assess security awareness, an auditor may review policies and standards, looking for evidence of management requiring that all employees receive regular awareness training, testing (e.g., phishing simulations) and performance feedback. In the context of the cloud, the organization must also consider this control through the lens of the shared responsibility model:
• Does the organization (cloud customer) have an awareness training program in place?
• Has the organization (cloud customer) checked that the CSP has an awareness training program in place?

Selected Answer: D
**D. Continuous integration**

Continuous integration (CI) is the most critical concept in managing the build and test of code in DevOps. CI involves automatically integrating code changes from multiple contributors into a shared repository several times a day. Each integration is automatically verified by building the application and running tests to detect errors as quickly as possible. This practice helps to identify and resolve code conflicts and integration issues early, ensuring that the codebase remains in a healthy state and reducing the risk of defects in the final product.

While continuous build, continuous delivery, and continuous deployment are also important in DevOps, continuous integration is the foundational practice that enables these other processes by ensuring that code changes are quickly and consistently verified.

Selected Answer: D
Page 347 - Continuous integration manages code building and testing, while continuous delivery refers to the ongoing creation of new features or artifacts. Continuous deployment refers to the assembly of the entire application stack into an executable environment

Selected Answer: D
Refer page 347 of guide

questions.question_text: The MOST critical concept of managing the build and test of code in DevOps is:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The Cloud Computing Compliance Controls Catalogue (C5) framework is maintained by:

**D. Bundesamt für Sicherheit in der Informationstechnik (BSI)**

BSI is the Federal Office for Information Security in Germany, and it developed the C5 framework to provide a standard for ensuring cloud service providers meet certain compliance and security requirements. The C5 framework is designed to help cloud customers assess the security capabilities of cloud providers and ensure that appropriate controls are in place.

questions.question_text: The Cloud Computing Compliance Controls Catalogue (C5) framework is maintained by which of the following agencies?

choices.B: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
choices.A: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d’information (ANSSI)
choices.D: Bundesamt für Sicherheit in der Informationstechnik (BSI)

choices.C: Organizations may transfer their responsibility and accountability for compliance with various regulatory requirements to their CSPs.
choices.B: Organizations may be able to transfer their responsibility for compliance with various regulatory requirements to their CSPs, but they retain the ownership of accountability.
choices.A: Organizations may be able to transfer their accountability for compliance with various regulatory requirements to their CSPs, but they retain the ownership of responsibility.
choices.D: Organizations are not able to transfer their responsibility nor accountability for compliance with various regulatory requirements to their CSPs.

questions.question_text: Which statement about compliance responsibilities and ownership of accountability is correct?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
p. 49 CCAK Study Guide - In the cloud, responsibility for some actions (e.g., implementation of security controls) can be transferred to the CSP; however, the cloud customer is ultimately accountable.

Selected Answer: B
The correct statement is:

**B. Organizations may be able to transfer their responsibility for compliance with various regulatory requirements to their CSPs, but they retain the ownership of accountability.**

In the context of cloud services, while organizations can delegate certain compliance responsibilities to their cloud service providers (CSPs), such as managing the security of the cloud infrastructure, the ultimate accountability for compliance with regulatory requirements remains with the organizations themselves. This means that even though CSPs may handle specific tasks or controls, the organization is ultimately accountable for ensuring that all compliance requirements are met.

Selected Answer: B
CCAK P# 65 With the introduction of the cloud, customers transfer to CSPs not only some IT stacks, but also some responsibility for policies, standards, business requirements, and legal and regulatory requirements. Although security is a shared responsibility between the cloud service provider and the organization, with responsibilities distributed across the stack, compliance accountability remains with the customer.

Selected Answer: B
"Shared responsibility model - The compliance responsibility between cloud customer and the cloud service provider based on the degree of control each party has over the architecture stack" p. 408 (glossary) CCAK study guide

questions.question_text: Which objective is MOST appropriate to measure the effectiveness of password policy?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The most appropriate objective to measure the effectiveness of a password policy is:

**D. The number of related incidents decreases.**

A decrease in the number of incidents related to password breaches or unauthorized access attempts suggests that the password policy is effective in enhancing security. This metric directly reflects the impact of the policy on reducing security incidents, which is a key indicator of its effectiveness. While other options may provide some insights, the ultimate goal of a password policy is to reduce security incidents, making option D the most relevant measure.

Selected Answer: D
Page 160 - Another option is to measure the number of monthly password security incidents reported to the support desk. The collected numbers should indicate whether the password policy reduces the number of password-related incidents, or if operationalization of the control is effective.

choices.B: Attempts to log with weak credentials increases.
choices.D: The number of related incidents decreases.
choices.C: Newly created account credentials satisfy requirements.
choices.A: The number of related incidents increases.
